DOC.brief_summary: The USDA Healthy Incentives Pilot ( HIP ) evaluate impact 30 % financial incentive fruit vegetable intake among adult participant USDA Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program ( SNAP ) .
DOC.detailed_description: U.S. fruit vegetable intake remain recommendation , particularly low-income population . Evidence effectiveness financial incentive address shortfall limit . This study examine effect USDA 's Healthy Incentives Pilot ( HIP ) , offer financial incentive Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program ( SNAP ) participant purchase target fruit vegetable ( TFV ) . A randomized control trial HIP conduct Hampden County , Massachusetts . 7,500 randomly select SNAP household receive 30 % rebate TFV purchase use SNAP benefit . The remain 47,595 SNAP household county receive benefit usual . Adults 5,076 household randomly sample complete telephone survey , include 24-h dietary recall interview . Surveys conduct baseline—1-3 mo pre-implementation—and two follow-up round , 4-6 mo 9-11 mo post-implementation . 2,784 adult ( 1,388 HIP , 1,396 non-HIP ) complete baseline interview ; data analyze 2,009 adult ( 72 % ) also complete least one follow-up interview .
DOC.criteria: Households residential mailing address Hampden County , Massachusetts Receiving SNAP benefit July 2011 Childonly case ( household include least one member age 16 old eligible serve SNAP head household ) Cases benefit sign residential treatment facility
